in_ports.name: file
in_ports.caption: file
in_ports.hint: [Optional] String path to the file. If specified, it is used instead of "File" parameter (with all replacements performed in that parameter).

in_ports.name: column_names
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] List of column names, separated by \n (name of every column in a separate line).
They are used only if "Write .meta file" flag is set. In this case, they are stored in "columnNames" and "columnIndexes" sections of the metadata JSON.

out_ports.name: absolute_path
out_ports.caption: absolute path
out_ports.hint: Actual full absolute path to the file

out_ports.name: parent_folder
out_ports.caption: parent folder
out_ports.hint: Absolute path to the parent folder of the file

controls.caption: File (raw sequence of bytes)
controls.name: file
controls.description:
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test.dat" or "samples/test.dat". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_file.dat, %TEMP%/my_file.dat or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_file.dat.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

controls.name: fileNameAdditionMode
controls.caption: How to add "file name addition" (for example XXX.DAT)
controls.description: This mode can be used together with input string "file name addition"

items.caption: no correction ("file name addition" is not used)
replace $$$ with the addition, but without its extension: /path/name$$$.ext => /path/nameXXX.ext

controls.caption: Secure mode
controls.name: secure
controls.description: If set, "file name addition" feature, Java system properties and executor system properties in the path are disabled, and the path is checked that it does not contain "suspicious" characters/substring like % (property?), ${... (variable inside a string?). Moreover, the path MUST be absolute; it will NOT be resolved relative any "current" folder. However, starting %TEMP%/ is allowed.

controls.name: requireInput
controls.caption: Requires input
controls.description: If set, the input port must contain some initialized matrix; in other case, this function will throw an exception or will delete the file (see below). If this flag is cleared, empty input port doesn't lead to any effect.

controls.caption: Clear file on reset
controls.description:
If set, the file is cleared (deleted) while reset, i.e. before 1st iteration of the loop. It can be useful while using loops in "Append to the end of file" mode: file will be created while 1st iteration and appended after all other iterations.
Note: if there is no loop, the file is deleted always; in other words, this flag just cancel effect of "Append to the end of file" flag.
controls.name: clearFileOnReset
appendToExistingFile
controls.caption: Append to the end of file
controls.description: Append numbers to the end of the existing file (if it exists)

controls.caption: Delete file for non-initialized
controls.description: Delete file if the input port is not initialized (in particular, as a result of an exception in previous blocks). This flag is ignored if "Requires input" is not set.
controls.name: deleteFileIfNonInitialized

controls.caption: Where to copy previous file
controls.description: Copy of previously existing file, deleted if the input port is not initialized
controls.name: copyOfPreviousFileIfNonInitialized

controls.caption: Byte order
controls.name: byteOrder
controls.description:
Note: we recommend to use "big-endian" to avoid compatibility problem while transferring the file to other platforms. But if you are sure that this file will be used at the same computer, the "native" order can little improve performance.
This order is not important for "byte" element type.

controls.caption: Write .meta file
controls.description:
If set, this function writes also JSON metadata file with information about block length (i.e. number of columns), element type, byte order and column names (when they are specified).
The name of metadata file is the name of main file + ".meta" suffix. For example, if the main file is "test.dat", then the metadata file will be "test.dat.meta".
controls.name: writeMetadataFile

controls.caption: Columns indexing base in .meta
controls.name: columnsIndexingBaseInMetadata
controls.description: If the previous flag is set, this parameter specifies the indexing base in "columnIndexes" sections of the metadata JSON: will be the stored index of the first column 0 or 1.

controls.caption: Column names
controls.description: If contains non-empty string with any non-space characters, and if the input "column_names" is not specified, this argument is used instead of the input "column_names".
controls.name: columnNames
